creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: five-level pagoda at center background; small hut with two figures at left in front of pagoda; weeping willow tree at right on the band of a calm body of water in foreground; pink sky
inscription: left: 自刻　昭和十七年作　五重乃塔 {Shikoku, Shōwa jūshichinen saku, [?????]} | bottom, in grey: Pagoda in Kyoto | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Pagoda in Kyoto
